$comment: Schema corresponding with Version 1 of the Whiteflag Protocol Specification DRAFT 6 as updated on 28 FEB 2019
title: Whiteflag Message
description: Whiteflag message to communicate pre-defined signs and signals in conflicts and disasters using blockchain technology.

MetaHeader.$comment: The contents of the meta header is not part of the Whiteflag message itself and is not standardised.
MetaHeader.description: Optional container for implementation specific metadata about the message or the underlying blockchain.

MessageHeader.description: Container for the message header fields, which are identical for all message types

Prefix.description: Identifies the message as a Whiteflag message

Version.description: Indicates which version of the standard is used to generate the message

EncryptionIndicator.description: Indicates if and which encryption is used

DuressIndicator.description: Indicates whether the message was sent under force or threat

ReferenceIndicator.description: Indicates how this message relates to an earlier message

ReferencedMessage.description: Blockchain dependend reference to a related earlier message

MessageBody.$comment: The MessageBody schema depends on the message type and is therefore specified for each MessageCode below
MessageBody.description: Container for the message body, which depends on the message type

VerificationMethod.description: Indicates the mechanism for authentication of the blockchain account

VerificationData.description: Provides the data required to perform the authentication

CryptoDataType.description: Indicates the type of cryptographic data in this message

PseudoMessageCode.description: Indicates which message type is tested

PseudoMessageBody.description: The body of the tested message

DateTime.description: Indicates from when the sign/signal is valid, using an UTC timestamp in the ISO 8601 / RFC 3339 date-time format

Duration.description: Indicates how long the sign/signal will be valid, using the ISO 8601 period format, with only days, hours and minutes

ObjectType.description: Specifies the type of object the sign/signal refers to

ObjectLatitude.description: Specifies the location of the object in decimal degrees latitude i.a.w. ISO 6709

ObjectLongitude.description: Specifies the location of the object in decimal degrees longitude i.a.w. ISO 6709

ObjectSizeDim1.description: Specifies the size of the first dimension of the object in meters

ObjectSizeDim2.description: Specifies the size of the second dimension of the object in meters

ObjectOrientation.description: Specifies the orientation of the object in degrees

requestObjects.description: Array holding the fields specifying the objects for which the request is made

ObjectType.description: Specifies the type of object for which the request is made

ObjectTypeQuant.description: Specifies the number of objects for which the request is made

ResourceData.description: Provides the data required to find the reference

specifications.$comment: The specifications object contains Whiteflag protocol specifications that are not part of the JSON message schema, and are therefore not automatically validated

MessageCode.title: Authentication
MessageCode.description: Message introducing the sender on the network with the sender's authentication data.

VerificationMethod.title: SharedToken
VerificationMethod.description: Authentication by a secret pre-shared token

MessageCode.title: Crypto
MessageCode.description: Message for management of keys and parameters of cryptographic functions.

CryptoDataType.title: HDExtPubKey
CryptoDataType.description: Serialised hierarchical deterministic extended public key

CryptoDataType.title: ECDHPubKey
CryptoDataType.description: Elliptic Curve Diffie–Hellman public key exchange

MessageCode.title: Test
MessageCode.description: Message that can be used for testing Whiteflag functionality by applications.

MessageCode.title: ProtectiveSign
MessageCode.description: Sign to mark objects under the protection of international law.

SubjectCode.description: Monuments and Cultural Institutions - Roerich Pact
Works and Installations containing Dangerous Forces

MessageCode.title: EmergencySignal
MessageCode.description: Signal to send an emergency signal when in need of assistance.

MessageCode.title: DangerSign
MessageCode.description: Sign to mark a location or area of imminent danger.

SubjectCode.description: Industrial Accident - Accident release (other than attack)
Industrial Accident - Chemical explosion (other than attack)
Industrial Accident - Nuclear explosion/Radiation (other than attack)
Complex/Manmade Hazard - Famine and Food Insecurity
Geophysical Disaster Area - Earthquake w/ Tsunami
Geophysical Disaster Area - Dry Mass Movement - Rockfall
Geophysical Disaster Area - Dry Mass Movement - Landslide
Geophysical Disaster Area - Dry Mass Movement - Avalanche
Geophysical Disaster Area - Dry Mass Movement - Subsidence
Meteorological Disaster Area - Storm - Tropical Cyclone
Meteorological Disaster Area - Storm - Extra Tropical Cyclone
Hydrological Disaster Area - Wet Mass Movement - Rockfall
Hydrological Disaster Area - Wet Mass Movement - Landslide
Hydrological Disaster Area - Wet Mass Movement - Avalanche
Hydrological Disaster Area - Wet Mass Movement - Subsidence
Climatological Disaster Area - Extreme Temp - Heat Wave
Climatological Disaster Area - Extreme Temp - Cold Wave
Climatological Disaster Area - Extreme Winter Condition
Climatological Disaster Area - Wildfire - Forest Fire
Climatological Disaster Area - Wildfire - Land Fire
Biological Disaster Area - Viral Infectious Disease Epidemic
Biological Disaster Area - Bacterial Infectious Disease Epidemic
Biological Disaster Area - Parasitic Infectious Disease Epidemic
Biological Disaster Area - Fungal Infectious Disease Epidemic
Biological Disaster Area - Prion Infectious Disease Epidemic

MessageCode.title: StatusSignal
MessageCode.description: Signal to provide the status of an object, or specifically for persons: give a proof of life.

SubjectCode.description: Proof of Life without further details
Proof of Life and Situation Normal
Proof of Life and Contact Requested
Proof of Life but Assistance Required
Object functional and in good order
Object not functional without further details
Water management - Drinking water distribution pipeline
Water management - Drinking water storage reservoir
Water management - Drinking water treatment facility
Water management - Waste water collection/disposal facility
Water management - Major flood control system
Water management - Coastal water management facility
Solid waste management - Unspecified solid waste management facility
Solid waste management - Municipal garbage and recyclables collection
Solid waste management - Solid waste landfill
Solid waste management - Solid waste incinerator
Solid waste management - Materials recovery facility
Solid waste management - Hazardous waste disposal facility

MessageCode.title: MissionSignal
MessageCode.description: Signal to provide information on activities undertaken during a mission.

SubjectCode.description: Humanitarian Law - Visiting Prisoners of War and Detained Persons
Humanitarian Law - Aid for Military Personnel - Health Care for wounded, sick or shipwrecked personnel
Humanitarian Law - Aid for Civilian Population - General Aid
Humanitarian Law - Aid for Civilian Population - Food Distribution
Humanitarian Law - Aid for Civilian Population - Health Care
Humanitarian Law - Aid for Civilian Population - Shelter
Humanitarian Law - Aid for Civilian Population - Restoring Family Links
Humanitarian Law - Aid for Civilian Population - Infrastructure Restoration
Humanitarian Law - Support to Local Government - Advisory

MessageCode.title: RequestSignal
MessageCode.description: Signal to perform requests to other parties.

MessageCode.title: Reference
MessageCode.description: Message to point to an internet resource.

MessageCode.title: FreeText
MessageCode.description: Message to send a free text string.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Original
ReferenceIndicator.description: This message provides new information and is not related to an earlier message.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Recall
ReferenceIndicator.description: The originator recalls the referenced message; the referenced message must be ignored.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Update
ReferenceIndicator.description: This message provides updated information and replaces the information in the referenced message.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Add
ReferenceIndicator.description: This message adds additional information to the referenced message, i.e. ties two messages together.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Discontinue
ReferenceIndicator.description: The originator discontinues the referenced message, i.e. the information or action is no longer valid.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Relate
ReferenceIndicator.description: The information in this message directly relates to the information or action in the referenced message.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Confirm
ReferenceIndicator.description: The originator confirms the information or action in the referenced message.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Acknowledge
ReferenceIndicator.description: The originator acknowledges the receipt of the referenced message, but the information itself is not confirmed.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Comply
ReferenceIndicator.description: The originator will comply with and/or act according to the referenced message, but the information itself is not confirmed.

ReferenceIndicator.title: Reject
ReferenceIndicator.description: The originator does not agree (any more) with the information or action in the referenced message.

ObjectType.title: Not provided
ObjectType.description: Object type is unknown

ObjectType.title: Unspecified group of people
ObjectType.description: Unspecified number of humans together

ObjectType.title: Person
ObjectType.description: An individual human

ObjectType.title: Small group of people
ObjectType.description: 2-   10 humans together

ObjectType.title: Medium group of people
ObjectType.description: 10-  100 humans together

ObjectType.title: Large group of people
ObjectType.description: 100- 1000 humans together

ObjectType.title: Enormous group of people
ObjectType.description: 1000-10000 humans together

ObjectType.title: Unspecified Area
ObjectType.description: An area is a part of the earths surface, either on land or at sea.

ObjectType.title: Circular Area
ObjectType.description: A circular area on the earths surface, either on land or at sea.

ObjectType.title: Rectangle Area
ObjectType.description: A rectangle area on the earths surface, either on land or at sea.

ObjectType.title: Triangle Area
ObjectType.description: A triangle area on the earths surface, either on land or at sea.

ObjectType.title: Unspecified Structure
ObjectType.description: Immovable human made individual structures that are fixed to the ground, such as buildings, installations, historic ruins, etc. For non-fixed human made structures or a clustering of structures, such as camps, an area object must be used.

ObjectType.title: Circular Structure
ObjectType.description: A circular immovable human made structure

ObjectType.title: Rectangle Structure
ObjectType.description: A rectangle immovable human made structure

ObjectType.title: Triangle Structure
ObjectType.description: A triangle immovable human made structure

ObjectType.title: Unspecified Land Vehicle
ObjectType.description: An object used for transport over land

ObjectType.title: Unspecified Water Vehicle
ObjectType.description: An object used for transport on water

ObjectType.title: Unspecified Air Vehicle
ObjectType.description: An object for transport in the air

ObjectType.title: Unspecified Space Vehicle
ObjectType.description: An object for transport in space

ObjectType.title: Unspecified goods
ObjectType.description: Movable materiel, goods, cargo, supplies, etc.
